job_tasks.phrase: In the near future, the Dutch manufacturing industry needs to improve on efficiency, flexibility and collaboration. Industry 4.0 (i4.0) addresses these challenges by leveraging IT solutions and connectivity to access, process and use data that is being generated in manufacturing.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the business context and challenges that the project aims to address within the manufacturing industry.

job_tasks.phrase: Learn about Industry 4.0 and the manufacturing domain
job_tasks.justification: This task explicitly requires understanding the business domain and industry trends.

job_tasks.phrase: This simulator generates realistic data for experimentation with international standards and new technology (e.g. generative AI).
job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'generative AI' indicates that modeling, specifically with generative techniques, is part of the experimental setup.

job_tasks.phrase: This assignment is about building a user-friendly and attractive user interface for the existing simulator.
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on building a user interface, which is a core software development task.

job_tasks.phrase: Investigate & evaluate concepts and solutions for defining experiments and low-code integration of 3rd party software
job_tasks.justification: Involves evaluating solutions and integrating third-party software, which are software development activities.

job_tasks.phrase: Design and implement the chosen solution in the user-interface
job_tasks.justification: Directly relates to designing and implementing software for the user interface.

job_tasks.phrase: Design and implement extensions for the backend, e.g. REST and websocket interfaces
job_tasks.justification: Involves designing and implementing backend services and interfaces, a key software development task.

job_tasks.phrase: CI/CD: Docker, Gitlab CI, unit tests
job_tasks.justification: Mentions Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) tools and practices like Docker and unit tests, which fall under Operations Engineering.
Writing tests is a crucial part of the software development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: to elicit the right design requirements and validate your work, you will work with data scientists and a production engineer from one of our clients on building a simulation of a real production line.
job_tasks.justification: Highlights collaboration with domain experts (data scientists, production engineer) to gather requirements and validate work, demonstrating business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: If any simulation capabilities are missing, either you or another team member will implement those.
job_tasks.justification: Implies the responsibility to implement missing software functionalities.

soft_skills.phrase: have an interest in the challenges that come with discrete simulation and software development
like working in a multi-disciplinary environment
You will join our team of experienced developers, working closely to collaborate and share expertise.
You work with people who will challenge you: who inspire you and want to learn from you.

classification.rationale: While the job description mentions generative AI, the core focus is on building a user interface and backend extensions for a simulator. The primary tasks are software development (TASK4) and understanding the business domain (TASK1), with limited emphasis on core generative AI modeling or MLOps specific to GenAI.
